text: wow, this really helped my understanding of React. Thank you
this is probably out of scope but do you have any documentation about how "tests" were setup? I noticed there's a ".snap" file (any recommended VS Code extensions?)
if I can test code against a screenshot...that would be insane

Snap stands for “snapshot”, which is a kind of test against a snapshot of data (in Jest, Vitest, and similar frameworks). 

How we’ve set things up, <https://vitest.dev|https://vitest.dev> tests should “just work”. (We use vitest tests internally, but I’m from my phone and haven’t double checked that all the packages necessary are inside the dev server)
thanks, I'll give that a try
image "snapshots" do exist but they require installing new packages (which is not allowed yet as far as I know)
